poem:
**Cold Reckoning**

Beneath a steel sky,  
old bones shiver as  
promises withdraw  
like breath on glass.  
History's chill seeps  
into hollow days,  
while coffers fill  
with whispers of  
what was never ours.  
The frostbite of policy  
cuts deeper—  
a winter without  
the balm of flame.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What are winter fuel payments and who will lose and keep them? On Monday the chancellor, Rachel Reeves, announced a package of measures designed to close a £22bn hole in the public finances she said was “covered up” by the Conservative government. Among them was a surprise removal of winter fuel payments for millions of pensioners and the abandoning of a long-delayed cap on what people pay for social care. What are winter fuel payments?". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
